Politics Businessweek Opinion More Chevron Down US Edition Chevron Down Menu Subscribe Business LaCroix Maker's Drop Erases $2.7 Billion of Founder's Wealth Parent company is grappling with slumping sales, competition Nick Caporella owns almost 75% of National Beverage shares Facebook X LinkedIn Email Link Gift Expand Photographer: Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg Facebook X LinkedIn Email Link Gift Gift this article Contact us: Provide news feedback or report an error Confidential tip? Send a tip to our reporters Site feedback: Take our Survey New Window Facebook X LinkedIn Email Link Gift By Devon Pendleton and Sophie Alexander June 12, 2019 at 1:18 PM UTC Updated on June 12, 2019 at 8:36 PM UTC Bookmark Save Lock This article is for subscribers only . Once the toast of millennials, the LaCroix brand of carbonated water is losing some sparkle for its billionaire owner. Nick Caporella , the octogenarian chairman and founder of LaCroix parent National Beverage Corp., has lost $2.7 billion -- more than half of his net worth -- in the past nine months. The stock tumbled 62% through Tuesday amid slumping sales, increased competition and a whistle-blower lawsuit alleging its cans contain toxic chemicals. Special Events | Tamarac, FL - Official Website Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In Government Departments Services Businesses How Do I 360° Tour Search Event Cancellations and Postponements Home Departments Parks & Recreation News and Special Events Special Events Special Events The City of Tamarac is committed to building community through enriching experiences. These events are designed with the entire family in mind and offered throughout the year. For more information about upcoming events, please contact (954) 597-3620 . Click HERE Version Options Special Events Headline to view event cancellations and postponements, or visit Stay Connected to sign-up for email and text message notifications. Upcoming Special Events Hispanic Heritage Month Join the City of Tamarac for an unforgettable celebration of Hispanic Heritage Month on Friday, September 19, at the Tamarac Village Amphitheatre, 9090 NW 57th St . The FREE outdoor concert begins at 6:30 P.M. and features four-time Grammy-winning artist Tomasito Cruz, whose performance is sure to leave you mesmerized. The open-air celebration includes on-site food trucks and live music featuring flamenco, salsa and Latin jazz. Don’t miss this beautiful evening of culture, music and community! When: Friday, September 19, 6:30 P.M.- 9:30 PM. Where: Tamarac Village Amphitheater, 9090 NW 57th St . Price: Free Admission. Limited on-site parking. Please use the continuous shuttle transportation from Tamarac Community Center, 8601 W. Commercial Blvd ., and Caporella Aquatic Center, 9300 NW 58th St. , from 6:30 P.M. - 9:30 PM. __________ Únase a la Ciudad de Tamarac en una inolvidable celebración del Mes de la Herencia Hispana el viernes 19 de septiembre en el Anfiteatro de Tamarac Village, 9090 NW 57th St. El concierto gratuito al aire libre comienza a las 18:00 hrs. y presenta al artista Tomasito Cruz, ganador de cuatro premios Grammy, cuya actuación seguramente lo dejará fascinado. La celebración al aire libre incluye camiones de comida y música en vivo destacando flamenco, salsa y jazz latino. ¡No se pierda esta hermosa noche de cultura, música y comunidad! Cuándo: Viernes 19 de septiembre, de 18:30 a 21:30 hrs. Dónde : Anfiteatro Tamarac Village, 9090 NW 57th St. Precio: Entrada gratuita. Estacionamiento limitado. Por favor, utilice el servicio de transporte continuo desde T amarac Community Center, 8601 W. Commercial Blvd. , y el Caporella Aquatic Center, 9300 NW 58th St. , de 18:30 a 21:30 hrs. Garage Sale Need to clear your closet or clean your garage? Come out to Tamarac Park, 7501 N. University Drive. , on Saturday, October 4th, from 7:30 A.M. - 12:30 P.M. to shop and browse the City's largest garage sale. Interested in being a vendor? Stop by the T amarac Recreation Center, 7501 N. University Drive. , or register on line at www.Tamarac.me/Webtrac today. Early Registration: July 1st - August 17th Fee: $30 per Vendor space Late Registration: August 18th - October 3rd Fee: $45 per vendor space A separate $30 clean up deposit per vendor is required for registration. When: Saturday, October 4th, 7:30am-12:30pm Where: Tamarac Park, 7501 N. University Drive . Vendor setup: 5:30 P.M. - 7:00 A.M. Halloween Hoopla Enjoy this FREE event for all ages which will include music, arts & crafts, bounce houses, face painting, carnival games, prizes, candy, and much more. First 500 kids will receive a free bag of treats. When: Friday, October 24, 6:00 P.M. – 8:30 P.M. Where: Tamarac Park, 7501 N. University Drive THE GREAT PUMPKIN SLASH Join us for some spooky water fun in our floating pumpkin patch. Enjoy pumpkin picking and decorating, a magic show, balloon art and fun for the whole family! When: Saturday, October 25, 10:00 A.M.- 1:00 P.M. Where: Caporella Aquatic Complex, 9300 NW 58 th Street Fee: $5 per guest, pre-registration is required at Tamarac.me/Events Walking Club Come out and meet with other active members in and around the community to engage in a free walking club! No pre-registration required. Bring water and a towel. When: First Wednesday of each month, 6:00 P.M. - 7:00 P.M. Where : Mainlands Park, 4500 Monterey Drive . Food Truck Fridays Bring your family and appetites to the Tamarac Village Amphitheater, 9090 NW. 57 St, on the 2nd and 4th Friday of the month to enjoy food, games and music at Food Truck Fridays! When: Every 2nd and 4th Friday of the Month, 5:00 P.M. - 9:00 P.M. Where: Tamarac Village Amphitheater , 9090 NW. 57 St. Tamarac Community Farmers Market The market is a great place to shop for fresh produce, tea, honey, sauces, baked goods, hummus, pickles, and other artisanal goodies. Come meet the producers and sample their locally prepared, all natural products. When: Every Sunday, 9:00 A.M. - 2:00 P.M. Where: Veterans' Memorial Park, 7825 Southgate Boulevard . Become a Sponsor! Sponsoring a special event is a great marketing approach to reach your desired audience. By partnering with the City of Tamarac, we will provide you with an avenue to promote your business and assist in increasing visibility in the community. Contact the Tamarac Parks and Recreation Department at (954) 597-3678 or email for more information. Concert in the Park Band Inquiries To submit your bands information for upcoming Concert in the Park events, please email and include your band's name, music genre, and links to your website, YouTube channel, etc. Submission does not guarantee a spot in the concert line-up. Food Truck and Food Vendor Inquiries Submit your information by email to be put on our food vendor list. Where: Caporella Aquatic Complex, 9300 NW 58 th Street Fee: $5 per guest, pre-registration is required at Tamarac.me/Events Walking Club Come out and meet with other active members in and around the community to engage in a free walking club! No pre-registration required. Bring water and a towel. When: First Wednesday of each month, 6:00 P.M. - 7:00 P.M. Where : Mainlands Park, 4500 Monterey Drive . Food Truck Fridays Bring your family and appetites to the Tamarac Village Amphitheater, 9090 NW. 57 St, on the 2nd and 4th Friday of the month to enjoy food, games and music at Food Truck Fridays! When: Every 2nd and 4th Friday of the Month, 5:00 P.M. - 9:00 P.M. Where: Tamarac Village Amphitheater , 9090 NW. 57 St. Tamarac Community Farmers Market The market is a great place to shop for fresh produce, tea, honey, sauces, baked goods, hummus, pickles, and other artisanal goodies. Come meet the producers and sample their locally prepared, all natural products. When: Every Sunday, 9:00 A.M. - 2:00 P.M. Where: Veterans' Memorial Park, 7825 Southgate Boulevard . Become a Sponsor! Sponsoring a special event is a great marketing approach to reach your desired audience. By partnering with the City of Tamarac, we will provide you with an avenue to promote your business and assist in increasing visibility in the community. Contact the Tamarac Parks and Recreation Department at (954) 597-3678 or email for more information. Concert in the Park Band Inquiries To submit your bands information for upcoming Concert in the Park events, please email and include your band's name, music genre, and links to your website, YouTube channel, etc. Submission does not guarantee a spot in the concert line-up. Food Truck and Food Vendor Inquiries Submit your information by email to be put on our food vendor list. Advertise with Forbes Forbes Licensing & Syndication Report a Security Issue Editorial Values and Standards Site Feedback Contact Us Careers at Forbes Tips Corrections Privacy Do Not Sell My Personal Information Terms AdChoices Reprints & Permissions Get in Touch Get In Touch With Nick Caporella Get In Touch PROFILE Nick Caporella $3.9B Real Time Net Worth as of 9/11/25 Reflects change since 5 pm ET of prior trading day. #1015 in the world today From the Editor Nick Caporella is the chairman and CEO of National Beverage, which he founded in 1985; it's best known for its LaCroix brand of sparkling water. The Pennsylvania native started out as a contractor and worked as the CEO of telecom firm Burnup & Sims before founding his soft drinks business. He kickstarted National Beverage by buying soda brand Shasta, then later added LaCroix to the portfolio in 1996. The Fort Lauderdale, Florida-based company, which trades under the ticker FIZZ, has faced increased competition from rivals like PepsiCo and other brands selling flavored fizzy water. Wealth History HOVER TO REVEAL NET WORTH BY YEAR Forbes Lists #362 Forbes 400 (2025) #948 Billionaires (2025) Personal Stats Age 89 Source of Wealth Beverages, Self Made Self-Made Score 9 Philanthropy Score 1 Residence Plantation, Florida Citizenship United States Marital Status Married Children 4 Did you know Caporella got his first taste of success in construction, where he reportedly scraped together $250 for a down payment on a used dragline excavator in 1957. Burnup & Sims acquired Caporella's contracting business in 1972, and he was tapped to become the CEO just four years later. By Jay Paris Contributor Oct 2, 2019 Here Are The 27 Billionaires Who Dropped Off The Forbes 400 Twenty-two billionaires lost their spot on the list of richest people in America as their fortunes fell, while five, including David Koch, Paul Allen and Ross Perot, died in the past year. By Will Yakowicz Forbes Staff Jun 11, 2019 Fired Executive Sues LaCroix And Its Billionaire Owner’s Son After Tussle Over BPA-Free Cans Shares of LaCroix parent National Beverage fell 5% on Tuesday, following an 8-month decline that has erased more than half the market capitalization of the company. By Jennifer Wang Former Staff Mar 8, 2019 National Beverage Stock's Lack Of Fizz Is Yet Another Indication That Corporate Governance Matters So, La Croix sales are falling due to litigation, but that litigation will not have a material adverse effect the company's operations.  That is the most self-contradictory messaging I have read in 26 years of reading quarterly SEC filings. It makes no sense. By Jim Collins Former Contributor Mar 8, 2019 LaCroix Owner Loses $500 Million In Hours, Blames ‘Injustice’ For Fizzling Sales When the people stop buying flavored water, one can only shake an angry fist at the sky. By Noah Kirsch Former Staff Oct 19, 2017 These Billionaires Made It Into The Forbes 400 Without Stepping On A College Campus These few high school grads and dropouts — from immigrants and farmers to heiresses and hustlers — managed to grow up and grow into $2 billion (at least) fortunes to become one of America’s richest. By Jennifer Wang Former Staff Apr 8, 2016 Huge Success Of LaCroix Sparkling Water Has Turned Beverage Firm Founder Into A New Billionaire Soft drinks company National Beverage doesn’t have nearly the name recognition enjoyed by Coca Cola or Pepsi, but a 80% surge in share price over the past year has catapulted its founder into billionairehood.
